task_summary: Remove the lid from the pot, place the pot onto the plate, then use the spatula tool to push the pot toward the front edge of the table.

task_long_description.overview: A single-arm tabletop robot operates on a setup with a small pot (with a removable lid), a plate, and a spatula-like tool. The robot must first open the pot by removing its lid, then grasp the pot and place it on the nearby plate. After placing, the robot grasps the spatula tool and, while aligning to the pot, pushes the pot toward the front edge of the table to complete the task. Motions should be deliberate with short per-step timeouts and gentle placement on the plate.
preconditions: Pot with lid, plate, and spatula are visible on the workspace
Robot has free gripper at start
Table surface is clear enough to manipulate
stepwise_plan: Perceive pot and remove lid using an open-container action.
Re-detect pot, compute grasp, grasp it and raise slightly.
Place pot onto the plate and release; retreat.
Perceive and grasp the spatula tool.
Align to pot and push it toward the front of the table.
success_criteria: Pot rests stably on the plate
Pot is pushed toward the table’s front edge
failure_and_recovery: If lid sticks: re-detect and retry open with a second attempt (not encoded here).
If grasp fails: recompute grasp and retry.
If push deviates: re-align to pot and repeat push.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when pot is on plate and has been pushed toward the front; robot has executed final retreat.

frame_3.now_evidence: Grasping sequence on pot appears underway with end-effector close and aligned.
frame_3.predicts_next: Lift and place are expected to follow promptly.

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Perceive visibility and pose of named target.
Open or remove the container’s closure (lid).
Compute grasp pose and write key to blackboard.
Execute grasp using a stored pose.
Lift the currently held object slightly.
Place target onto a named surface area.
Align tool/EE with target within tolerance.
Use specified tool to push target in a direction over a distance.

failure_modes: Lid not detachable or slips during opening
Tool grasp fails or push direction incorrect
recovery_strategy: Short retreat then retry with new approach
assumptions: The spatula in the frames is the intended tool.
‘Front of the table’ corresponds to camera-down/table-front direction; mapped to direction_deg=180.
Plate is the small round dish visible; pot is the small lidded container.

expected_success_criteria: Pot rests centered on the plate
Pot final position is closer to front edge than start
